core

Class VNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • tree.SimpleTreeNode
      • core.VNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Directory, File

    public abstract class VNode
extends SimpleTreeNode
    An absract representation of a node in the virtual file system tree. It can be a File or a Directory.
    Author:
    Ayoub
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public abstract void move(Directory newDirectory)
        moves the VNode to another directory
        Parameters:
        newDirectory - to Directory where the VNode will be moved
        Throws:
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if moving data blocks fails

      • copy

        public abstract void copy(Directory newDirectory)
        copies the VNode to another directory
        Parameters:
        newDirectory - to Directory where the VNode will be moved
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoFreeSpaceLeftException - if the virtual disk doesn't have enough space
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if copying data blocks fails

      • exportToHostFileSystem

        public abstract void exportToHostFileSystem(java.lang.String exportPath)
        exports the VNode to the host file system
        Parameters:
        exportPath - the path to where the VNode will be exported on the host file system
        Throws:
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails

      • remove

        public abstract void remove()
        removes the VNode from the virtual file system where it belongs. every file's data is lost.

      • isFile

        public boolean isFile()
        checks if VNode is File
        Returns:
        true if VNode is File, false if not

      • isDirectory

        public boolean isDirectory()
        checks if VNode is Directory
        Returns:
        true if VNode is Directory, false if not

      • printAllContent

        public java.lang.String printAllContent()
        returns a String containing all the content of the VNode formatted in a tree structure.
        Returns:
        a String containing the tree structure starting from the receiver's node in the virtual file system
